Description: Part of rim sherd of Attic red-figured pottery calyx-krater; interior: glazed black with horizontal reserved band; exterior: around rim frieze of ivy and berries on a vine in black glaze; reserved groove at junction of rim and wall; wall glazed black.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Compared by Beazley to Oxford G714 (CVA Oxford (2) III I 120 7 pl. 66, 14) and Oxford 1912. 39 (2) (CVA Oxford 1, pl. 50, 2), recalling the Eucharides Painter (Beazley in CVA; not in ARV2).
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p. 41 no. C 17 pl. 15.1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0997)
